head.title: Still Hip After All These Years

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Music, Theater and Dance

hedline.hl1: Still Hip After All These Years

abstract.p: Rock musician Neil Young is slated to perform at Blockbuster Sony Entertainment Center in Camden and PNC Bank Arts Center in Holdel, NJ; photo (S)

block.p: Most young people would scoff at the thought of anyone over 25 years old being considered hip. But Neil Young, at 54, is embraced by a whole generation of young music lovers who consider him ''The Godfather of Grunge.''
The best part of Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young, his music ranges from raging rock-guitar distortion to plaintive acoustic piano playing.

Most young people would scoff at the thought of anyone over 25 years old being considered hip. But Neil Young, at 54, is embraced by a whole generation of young music lovers who consider him ''The Godfather of Grunge.''
The best part of Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young, his music ranges from raging rock-guitar distortion to plaintive acoustic piano playing.

When he comes to the Blockbuster Sony Entertainment Center in Camden at 8 p.m. Wednesday and the PNC Bank Arts Center in Holmdel at 8 p.m. Aug. 19, he will be performing mostly from his new ''Silver and Gold'' album, a sometimes sappy, always eloquent, simply-crafted recording that sounds like a stripped-down ''Harvest.''
Count on him performing totally engrossing sonic revelations from the past as well.
